member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.AtomicDictionary`1
member.summary: Performs all actions on values alongside dictionary manipulation in an atomic and thread-safe way.
member.typeparam: The type of the values in the dictionary.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.AtomicDictionary`1.ActionAndRemove(System.String,System.Action{`0})
member.summary: Will perform a thread-safe action using the specific key/value and then remove this key/value. If the key does not exist it will do nothing.
member.param: The action to perform before removal.
member.returns: A indicating if the removal was a success.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.AtomicDictionary`1.Add(System.String,`0)
member.summary: Add the value. If it already exists it will do nothing.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.AtomicDictionary`1.GetOrAddAndAction(System.String,`0,System.Action{`0})
member.summary: Tries to add the key/value, or create a new one if it doesn't exist and then perform the thread-safe action indicated with that key/value.
member.param: In case a new key needs to be added, this should be the value.
The action to perform with the key/value.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.AtomicDictionary`1.GetAndAction(System.String,System.Action{`0})
member.summary: Tries to get the specific key/value and perform a thread-safe action with it. Will do nothing if key doesn't exist.
member.param: The action to perform with the key/value.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.AtomicDictionary`1.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the value if it exists. Does nothing if it doesn't exist.

member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the page of the table to be returned. This has only effect on partial tables. This setting has no effect when querying normal tables, where all rows will be returned.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.TableFilter.IsIncludeAllPages
member.summary: Gets or sets the indication if all pages of a partial table should be returned. Warning: when setting to 'true' on a partial table, without extra filtering, could result in a large object being returned, this could have a large impact on SLElement, SLNet, SLNetCom and SLScripting. This setting has no effect when querying normal tables, where all rows will be returned.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.TableFilter.Filter
member.summary: Gets the collection of filters that will be applied when querying the table. Every item in the filter will be combined as a logical AND.

The value of a set operation is empty or white space.

The value of a set operation contains a forbidden character.
The value of a set operation contains more than one '%' character.
A set operation is not supported on a DVE child or a derived element.

remarks.para: The following restrictions apply to element names:

item.para: Names may not start or end with the following characters: '.' (dot), ' ' (space).
Names may not contain the following characters: '\', '/', ':', '*', '?', '"', '<', '>', '|', '°', ';'.
The following characters may not occur more than once within a name: '%' (percentage).

member.summary: Removes all items in the specified collection from the current set.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.DmsViewSet.SymmetricExceptWith(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.IDmsView})
member.summary: Modifies the current set to contain only items that are present either in this object or in the specified collection, but not both.
member.param: The collection to compare to the current object.
member.remarks: If the other parameter is a collection with the same equality comparer as the current object, this method is an O(n) operation. Otherwise, this method is an O(n + m) operation, where n is the number of items in and m is Count.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.DmsViewSet.IsSubsetOf(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.IDmsView})
member.summary: Determines whether this set is a subset of the specified collection.
member.param: The collection to compare to the current object.
member.returns: true if this object is a subset of other; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: An empty set is a subset of any other collection, including an empty set. Therefore, this method returns true if the collection represented by the current object is empty, even if the other parameter is an empty set.
This method always returns false if Count is greater than the number of items in .

If the collection represented by other is a collection with the same equality comparer as the current object, this method is an O(n) operation. Otherwise, this method is an O(n + m) operation, where n is Count and m is the number of items in .

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.DmsViewSet.IsSupersetOf(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.IDmsView})
member.summary: Determines whether this object is a superset of the specified collection.
member.param: The collection to compare to the current object.
member.returns: true if the object is a superset of other; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: All collections, including the empty set, are supersets of the empty set. Therefore, this method returns true if the collection represented by the other parameter is empty, even if the current object is empty.
This method always returns false if Count is less than the number of items in .

If the collection represented by other is a collection with the same equality comparer as the current object, this method is an O(n) operation. Otherwise, this method is an O(n + m) operation, where n is the number of items in and m is Count.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.DmsViewSet.IsProperSupersetOf(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.IDmsView})
member.summary: Determines whether the object is a proper superset of the specified collection.
member.param: The collection to compare to the current object.
member.returns: true if this object is a proper superset of other; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: An empty set is a proper superset of any other collection. Therefore, this method returns true if the collection represented by the other parameter is empty unless the current collection is also empty.
This method always returns false if Count is less than or equal to the number of elements in other.

If the collection represented by other is a collection with the same equality comparer as the current object, this method is an O(n) operation. Otherwise, this method is an O(n + m) operation, where n is the number of elements in other and m is Count.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.DmsViewSet.IsProperSubsetOf(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.IDmsView})
member.summary: Determines whether this object is a proper subset of the specified collection.
member.param: The collection to compare to the current object.
member.returns: true if this object is a proper subset of other; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: An empty set is a proper subset of any other collection. Therefore, this method returns true if the collection represented by the current object is empty unless the other parameter is also an empty set.
This method always returns false if Count is greater than or equal to the number of items in other.

If the collection represented by other is a collection with the same equality comparer as the current object, then this method is an O(n) operation. Otherwise, this method is an O(n + m) operation, where n is Count and m is the number of items in .

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.DmsViewSet.Overlaps(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.IDmsView})
member.summary: Determines whether the current object and a specified collection share common items.
member.param: The collection to compare to the current object.
member.returns: true if this object and other share at least one common element; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method is an O(n) operation, where n is the number of items in .

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.DmsViewSet.SetEquals(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.IDmsView})
member.summary: Determines whether this object and the specified collection contain the same items.
member.param: The collection to compare to the current object.
member.returns: true if this set is equal to ; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The SetEquals method ignores duplicate entries and the order of items in the parameter.

If the collection represented by other is a collection with the same equality comparer as the current object, this method is an O(n) operation. Otherwise, this method is an O(n + m) operation, where n is the number of items in and m is Count.

The value of a set operation contains a forbidden character.
The value of a set operation contains more than one '%' character.
A set operation is not supported on a DVE child or a derived element.

remarks.para: The following restrictions apply to element names:

item.para: Names may not start or end with the following characters: '.' (dot), ' ' (space).
Names may not contain the following characters: '\', '/', ':', '*', '?', '"', '<', '>', '|', '°', ';'.
The following characters may not occur more than once within a name: '%' (percentage).

member.summary: Gets or sets the service name.

member.exception: The value of a set operation is .
The value of a set operation is empty or white space.
The value of a set operation exceeds 200 characters.
The value of a set operation contains a forbidden character.
The value of a set operation contains more than one '%' character.

remarks.para: The following restrictions apply to service names:

item.para: Names may not start or end with the following characters: '.' (dot), ' ' (space).
Names may not contain the following characters: '\', '/', ':', '*', '?', '"', '<', '>', '|', '°', ';'.
The following characters may not occur more than once within a name: '%' (percentage).

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Core.DataMinerSystem.Common.DmsColumn`1.GetAlarmLevel(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the alarm level of the cell that corresponds with the specified key.
member.exception: The element was not found in the DataMiner System.
member.returns: The alarm level.

remarks.para: The key is assumed to be the display key. If no display key was found with the specified value, but a row exists with a primary key with the specified value, then the value of that row will be returned (only the case if the naming option or NamingFormat is in the protocol XML is used, not for the deprecated displayColumn attribute).
Do not use this call with primary keys in case the primary key value is also used as display key of another row.
This overload is deprecated. Use the overload with the additional KeyType argument instead.
